_header: A for Alyn Mallson that was armed in a mat
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 10
_description: A ‘Crosse Rowe’ poem ribald in character — 46 lines in long couplets.

BLIA3420.First Lines:
A is for Alyn Mallson that was armyde in a mattAnd rode to Rychmar
                    for to fyght with a gnattB is for bartem the baker that brostyn mutt he
                    be…
BLIA3420.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A Tudor ‘Crosse Rowe.’” 
             Journal of English and Germanic Philology
         58 (1959): 248-50: 249-50.
Orme,  Nicholas. 
             “Children and Literature in Medieval England.” 
             Medium Ævum
         68 (1999): 218-46: 235 (extract).
